item.description:
Enjoy Kayaking at Hopkinton State Park! Rent or bring your own.
Cost is $15 per hour. Plus, $5 to get into the Park. If you have never kayaked before, they will teach you how. It's easy, fun, and the reservoir is beautiful!

Bring a picnic lunch to enjoy after Kayaking. Also, bring a chair to relax afterwards and hang out at the park. Swimming is also available.

Canoes and sailboats available for rent as well. http://www.outdoorrec...


See the Park: http://www.mass.gov/d...

Park Directions

268 Cedar Street, Hopkinton, MA 01748

Rte. I-495 (north or south) to exit 21A, Main Street Hopkinton. Travel on Main Street until the third traffic light located at the heart of downtown Hopkinton. Turn left, traveling North on Route 85. Proceed approximately 2 miles to the Hopkinton State Park entrance on the right (do not enter the Field Office on the left).

You can also get here from Route 9 by taking Route 85 towards Hopkinton - park on left.

Jacki's cell: 508-381-1529
item.how_to_find_us: Meet at the boat rental (follow signs) My cell is 508-381-1529
item.name: Labor Day Kayaking at Hopkinton State Park
